items.title: Trump cannot fire Fed's Lisa Cook before FOMC meeting, appeals court rules
Senate confirms Stephen Miran to Fed Board. Who is he and why's he so controversial?
items.standfirst: The Senate voted Monday to confirm Stephen Miran to the Federal Reserve Board. Miran, who has served in both Trump administrations, has said he will not resign from the White House but take a leave of absence, further stoking concerns about its independence.
items.content: The Senate voted Monday to confirm Stephen Miran to the Federal Reserve Board. Miran, who has served in both Trump administrations, has said he will not resign from the White House but take a leave of absence, further stoking concerns about its independence.(Image credit: Aaron Schwartz)

ai_summary: An appeals court ruled Lisa Cook can remain a Federal Reserve governor.
The ruling rebuffed Donald Trump's efforts to remove her from the Fed.
Trump's attempt to oust Cook was the first by a president since 1913.
The Senate confirmed a Trump aide to the Fed board before a policy meeting.
S&P 500 futures were little changed after the Senate vote on Monday.

clusters.title: 9/15: CBS Evening News
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Announces Second Strike on Alleged Venezuelan Drug Boat

items.title: 9/15: CBS Evening News
items.standfirst: Trump announces second strike on alleged drug boat from Venezuela; "Adolescence" star Owen Cooper becomes youngest male Emmy winner
items.content: Trump announces second strike on alleged drug boat from Venezuela; "Adolescence" star Owen Cooper becomes youngest male Emmy winner

items.title: Trump announces deadly US strike on another alleged Venezuelan drug boat
items.standfirst: President says three people killed in strike against vessel he said was transporting drugs ‘headed to the US’Donald Trump said on Monday that the United States had carried out a strike on a second Venezuelan boat and killed three alleged terrorists he claimed were transporting drugs, expanding his administration’s war against drug cartels and the scope of lethal military force to stop them.The US president gave few details about the strike, saying in a social media post that the action was on his orders and that it had happened earlier in the morning. The post was accompanied by a video clip showing the boat, which appeared to be stationary, erupting into a fireball. Continue reading...
items.content: President says three people killed in strike against vessel he said was transporting drugs ‘headed to the US’Donald Trump said on Monday that the United States had carried out a strike on a second Venezuelan boat and killed three alleged terrorists he claimed were transporting drugs, expanding his administration’s war against drug cartels and the scope of lethal military force to stop them.The US president gave few details about the strike, saying in a social media post that the action was on his orders and that it had happened earlier in the morning. The post was accompanied by a video clip showing the boat, which appeared to be stationary, erupting into a fireball. Continue reading...

items.content: President Donald Trump alleged that "narcoterrorists" were on the boat and that they were carrying illegal drugs destined for the United States.

items.content: The attack came after the Venezuelan president said Caracas would defend itself against US "aggression".

items.title: US military strikes alleged Venezuelan drug boat in Caribbean
items.standfirst: The deadly hit was the second such manoeuvre in the area in as many weeks
items.content: The deadly hit was the second such manoeuvre in the area in as many weeks

items.title: Venezuela's Maduro vows to resist US 'aggression', calls Rubio 'lord of death'
items.standfirst: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro on Monday said Caracas would defend itself from US "aggression" as he lashed out at US Secretary of State Marco Rubio over his tough rhetoric on drug cartels and warned that communications with Washington had "broken down". Shortly after his speech, President Donald Trump said the US military had again targeted a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela, killing three aboard the vessel.
items.content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro on Monday said Caracas would defend itself from US "aggression" as he lashed out at US Secretary of State Marco Rubio over his tough rhetoric on drug cartels and warned that communications with Washington had "broken down". Shortly after his speech, President Donald Trump said the US military had again targeted a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela, killing three aboard the vessel.

items.title: Watch: Winning moments from the 77th Emmy Awards
items.standfirst: Adolescence star Owen Cooper became the youngest ever male winner and The Pitt took out the top drama series award.
items.content: Adolescence star Owen Cooper became the youngest ever male winner and The Pitt took out the top drama series award.

ai_summary: Trump announced a second U.S. military strike on an alleged Venezuelan drug boat.
The strike resulted in the deaths of three individuals, according to Trump.
Trump stated the boat was transporting drugs "headed to the US".
Venezuelan President Maduro vowed to defend against U.S. "aggression".
The U.S. military has now conducted two strikes in the area in recent weeks.

clusters.title: Senate confirms Stephen Miran for seat on Federal Reserve board as Trump’s bid to oust Lisa Cook foiled by court - as it happened
clusters.neutral_headline: Rubio's Trip to Israel, Qatar Summit

items.title: Senate confirms Stephen Miran for seat on Federal Reserve board as Trump’s bid to oust Lisa Cook foiled by court - as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is now closed.Secretary of state Marco Rubio will travel to Qatar on Tuesday, the Washington Post is reporting, after holding talks with Benjamin Netanyahu today in Israel.As my colleague Julian Borger writes: “Part of [Rubio’s] mission on this two-day visit is to convey Donald Trump’s irritation at the Israeli missile strike on Doha that was aimed at Hamas leadership but killed their aides and a Qatari security officer.Common sense dictates that drone technology should be harnessed to scan every elevated structure with a line of sight to a target.If drones can enable the early detection and prevention of assassination attempts, why not use them? Better to have vigilant eyes in the sky than to remain blind to would-be assassins. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is now closed.Secretary of state Marco Rubio will travel to Qatar on Tuesday, the Washington Post is reporting, after holding talks with Benjamin Netanyahu today in Israel.As my colleague Julian Borger writes: “Part of [Rubio’s] mission on this two-day visit is to convey Donald Trump’s irritation at the Israeli missile strike on Doha that was aimed at Hamas leadership but killed their aides and a Qatari security officer.Common sense dictates that drone technology should be harnessed to scan every elevated structure with a line of sight to a target.If drones can enable the early detection and prevention of assassination attempts, why not use them? Better to have vigilant eyes in the sky than to remain blind to would-be assassins. Continue reading...

items.title: What to know about Rubio's trip to Israel, Qatar summit
items.standfirst: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio met in Jerusalem with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, as close U.S. ally Qatar gathered other Arab nations' leaders for a summit to issue a unified condemnation of last week's Israeli airstrike targeting Hamas leaders in the Qatari capital. Elizabeth Palmer reports.
items.content: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio met in Jerusalem with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, as close U.S. ally Qatar gathered other Arab nations' leaders for a summit to issue a unified condemnation of last week's Israeli airstrike targeting Hamas leaders in the Qatari capital. Elizabeth Palmer reports.

items.title: Netanyahu does not rule out further strikes on Hamas leaders abroad
items.standfirst: At a joint press conference with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Netanyahu said every country had the right "to defend itself beyond its borders".
items.content: At a joint press conference with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Netanyahu said every country had the right "to defend itself beyond its borders".

items.title: Rubio says Netanyahu has full support of US over plans to destroy Hamas
items.standfirst: US secretary of state, who is visiting Jerusalem, warns of ‘Israeli counter reaction’ if allies recognise PalestineThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, has put the Trump administration’s full support behind Benjamin Netanyahu in a visit to Jerusalem, saying Washington’s priorities were the liberation of Israeli hostages and the destruction of Hamas.In public remarks standing alongside Netanyahu, Rubio did not mention the possibility of a ceasefire, and did not repeat his earlier criticism of Israel for carrying out an airstrike last week aimed at Hamas leaders in Doha, the capital of another close US ally, Qatar. Continue reading...
items.content: US secretary of state, who is visiting Jerusalem, warns of ‘Israeli counter reaction’ if allies recognise PalestineThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, has put the Trump administration’s full support behind Benjamin Netanyahu in a visit to Jerusalem, saying Washington’s priorities were the liberation of Israeli hostages and the destruction of Hamas.In public remarks standing alongside Netanyahu, Rubio did not mention the possibility of a ceasefire, and did not repeat his earlier criticism of Israel for carrying out an airstrike last week aimed at Hamas leaders in Doha, the capital of another close US ally, Qatar. Continue reading...

items.title: Devastation in Gaza: Survivors struggle amid intensifying bombings
items.standfirst: At least 16 Palestinians have died on Monday in strikes on Gaza City as Israel intensifies its bombing campaign across the enclave. Meanwhile, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio meets with the Israeli Prime Minister, and Arab leaders gather in Qatar. Solange Mougin reports on the impact of the strikes and daily life for Palestinians in the aftermath.
items.content: At least 16 Palestinians have died on Monday in strikes on Gaza City as Israel intensifies its bombing campaign across the enclave. Meanwhile, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio meets with the Israeli Prime Minister, and Arab leaders gather in Qatar. Solange Mougin reports on the impact of the strikes and daily life for Palestinians in the aftermath.

items.title: Netanyahu refuses to rule out further strikes on Hamas leaders abroad
items.standfirst: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has refused to rule out further strikes on Hamas leaders abroad.
items.content: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has refused to rule out further strikes on Hamas leaders abroad.

ai_summary: Marco Rubio met with Benjamin Netanyahu in Jerusalem.
Qatar hosted a summit of Arab nations to condemn an Israeli airstrike.
Netanyahu does not rule out further strikes on Hamas leaders abroad.
Rubio said Netanyahu has full support of the US to destroy Hamas.
The US secretary of state is visiting Jerusalem.

items.title: US and China reach deal to transfer TikTok ownership, trade officials say
items.standfirst: Framework deal is breakthrough in long-running dispute over app’s ownership amid security concerns in WashingtonJamieson Greer, a US trade representative, said on Monday that Washington and Beijing have struck a framework agreement on transferring TikTok to US-controlled ownership.Speaking after emerging from negotiations with Chinese officials, Scott Bessent said the deal was coming but declined to reveal the commercial terms. Continue reading...
items.content: Framework deal is breakthrough in long-running dispute over app’s ownership amid security concerns in WashingtonJamieson Greer, a US trade representative, said on Monday that Washington and Beijing have struck a framework agreement on transferring TikTok to US-controlled ownership.Speaking after emerging from negotiations with Chinese officials, Scott Bessent said the deal was coming but declined to reveal the commercial terms. items.title: US says ‘framework’ deal for transfer of TikTok ownership agreed with China
items.standfirst: The United States on Monday announced a “framework” deal with China to resolve a longstanding dispute over TikTok that would transfer the Chinese-owned app to US-controlled ownership. US President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping are expected to confirm the deal in a call on Friday.
items.content: The United States on Monday announced a “framework” deal with China to resolve a longstanding dispute over TikTok that would transfer the Chinese-owned app to US-controlled ownership. US President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping are expected to confirm the deal in a call on Friday.

ai_summary: Hong Kong stocks rose after the US and China reached a deal.
The deal involves transferring TikTok to US-controlled ownership.
US President Trump and Xi Jinping are expected to confirm the deal.
A framework agreement was reached after negotiations with China.
The deal is a breakthrough in the dispute over TikTok's ownership.

items.title: Trump to send national guard to Memphis and says Chicago is ‘probably next’
items.standfirst: Move is latest push by administration to expand military-led response to urban crime in Democratic-run citiesDonald Trump on Monday signed an executive order that would send national guard troops into Memphis, in a “replica” of the administration’s expanding military-led response to urban crime in Democratic-run cities.The move was welcome by Tennessee’s Republican governor, Bill Lee, who stood behind Trump in the Oval Office as he signed a presidential memo establishing a Memphis Safe Task Force. items.title: Memphis becomes latest target of Trump's crackdown
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Monday ordered National Guard troops into Memphis, casting the city as a crime hotspot despite police figures showing overall crime at a 25-year low.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Monday ordered National Guard troops into Memphis, casting the city as a crime hotspot despite police figures showing overall crime at a 25-year low.

ai_summary: Trump ordered the National Guard to Memphis, Tennessee.
The move is part of an effort to expand military-led crime response.
Memphis is the latest target of Trump's crackdown on crime.
The order was signed Monday, according to reports.
Tennessee's governor welcomed the move.

items.title: What to know after US says it has reached framework deal with China to keep TikTok in operation
US, China Reach TikTok Deal Framework Says Bessent
items.standfirst: In trade talks with China, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said a framework deal to keep the TikTok app running in the US has been reached. Bloomberg’s Alexandra Levine explains what a deal could look like on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: In trade talks with China, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said a framework deal to keep the TikTok app running in the US has been reached. Bloomberg’s Alexandra Levine explains what a deal could look like on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: US says 'framework' for TikTok ownership deal agreed with China
items.standfirst: The deal will pave the way to US ownership of the social media platform's American operations, according to the US treasury secretary.
items.content: The deal will pave the way to US ownership of the social media platform's American operations, according to the US treasury secretary.

items.title: Bessent Says Trump’s Threat of TikTok Shutdown Delivered Deal
items.standfirst: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the threat of allowing the social media app TikTok to go dark in the US was what ultimately sealed a framework deal in Madrid that would see the American iteration of the platform enter US hands — severing connections with its Chinese parent company ByteDance.
items.content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the threat of allowing the social media app TikTok to go dark in the US was what ultimately sealed a framework deal in Madrid that would see the American iteration of the platform enter US hands — severing connections with its Chinese parent company ByteDance.

items.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect under special watch as investigators seek motive
items.standfirst: The suspect in the assassination of Charlie Kirk is under special watch in a Utah jail, days after he allegedly shot and killed the 31-year-old conservative activist.
items.content: The suspect in the assassination of Charlie Kirk is under special watch in a Utah jail, days after he allegedly shot and killed the 31-year-old conservative activist.

items.title: What to know about the aftermath of Charlie Kirk’s assassination
items.standfirst: Authorities are still investigating the motive behind the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, with suspect Tyler James Robinson, 22, arrested on suspicion of aggravated murder. While Robinson’s leftist ideology and possible online radicalization are being explored, the investigation has yet to confirm a clear motive, and his connection to Kirk's anti-trans views remains uncertain, as FRANCE 24's James André explains.
items.content: Authorities are still investigating the motive behind the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, with suspect Tyler James Robinson, 22, arrested on suspicion of aggravated murder. items.title: Spanish PM wants Israel banned from international sports events after chaos at cycling race
items.standfirst: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on Monday reiterated his "deep admiration" for pro-Palestinian protesters who forced the abandonment of the Vuelta's final stage. However, the head of Spain's premier cycling race delivered a stern rebuke, calling the chaotic scenes "absolutely unacceptable". FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.
items.content: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on Monday reiterated his "deep admiration" for pro-Palestinian protesters who forced the abandonment of the Vuelta's final stage. However, the head of Spain's premier cycling race delivered a stern rebuke, calling the chaotic scenes "absolutely unacceptable". FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

items.title: Final stage of Spain's Vuelta abandoned after police clash with pro-Palestinian protesters
items.standfirst: 🚴🇪🇸 The final stage of #Spain's #Vuelta #cycling race was abandoned on Sunday afternoon as #cyclists were entering #Madrid after police clashed with pro-#Palestinian protesters in the Spanish capital's centre
items.content: 🚴🇪🇸 The final stage of #Spain's #Vuelta #cycling race was abandoned on Sunday afternoon as #cyclists were entering #Madrid after police clashed with pro-#Palestinian protesters in the Spanish capital's centre

items.title: Pro-Palestinian protesters force an early end to Vuelta a Espana cycle race
items.standfirst: Pro-Palestinian protesters forced the Vuelta a Espana cycle race to be abandoned at its final stage as demonstrations blocked the finish line. Six of the last 10 days of the 1,900-mile race were either cut short or interrupted with protesters targeting an Israeli-owned team over the country’s war in Gaza.
items.content: Pro-Palestinian protesters forced the Vuelta a Espana cycle race to be abandoned at its final stage as demonstrations blocked the finish line. Six of the last 10 days of the 1,900-mile race were either cut short or interrupted with protesters targeting an Israeli-owned team over the country’s war in Gaza.

items.title: Duplantis soars to new pole vault record and retains world title
items.standfirst: Armand 'Mondo' Duplantis said a raucous Tokyo crowd was "the difference maker" as he set yet another world pole vault record on Monday, four years after triumphing at the pandemic-troubled Olympics in the same stadium. FRANCE 24's Caroline Baum reports.
